name: wl-alanbii
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2
body: |- wb(wal(s0, w0), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))

stmt.origin: bitri(wal(s0, w0), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)), wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wal(s0, w0), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
-| wb(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)))
-| wb(wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wal(s0, w0), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
-| wb(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)))
-| wb(wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)))
-| wb(w0, wa(w1, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wal(s0, w0), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
-| wb(wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
-| wb(w0, wa(w1, w2))

body.origin: |- wb(wal(s0, wa(w1, w2)), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wal(s0, w0), wa(wal(s0, w1), wal(s0, w2)))
-| wb(w0, wa(w1, w2))

comment: This theorem extends ~ alanimi to a biconditional. Recurrent usage stacks up more quantifiers. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 4-Oct-2019.)
